In order to play the variety of battles included in this expansion, players will need a copy of the Commands & Colors: Napoleonic core game and many of its expansions (Spanish Army, Russian Army, Austrian Army, Prussian Army, Generals, Marshals & Tacticians, EPIC Napoleonics and The Grand Battles).

Name: Cruel Seas: Campaign Pack
Description: Originally part of Warlord Games D-Day 75th Anniversary Campaign, these Cruel Seas scenarios allow you to re-enact, or repel, the D-Day landings and battle across the channel for naval supremacy.

Name: Arkham Horror (Third Edition): Under Dark Waves
Description:
Cold salt waves beat on the New England coast and thick fog rolls in off the bay, obscuring the small fishing hamlets that nestle in the darkness. Dark things creep along the shoreline, strange lights glide deep beneath the surface of the Atlantic, and the pallid villagers go missing with disturbing regularity.

Under Dark Waves is a new large box expansion for Arkham Horror, taking your investigations beyond the town of Arkham to the other ill-fated towns of Massachusetts. Two new double-sided tiles bring Kingsport and Innsmouth to vibrant life, while eight more investigators arrive to join your party, ranging from a drifter like “Ashcan” Pete to a letter carrier such as Stella Clark. These investigators will have their work cut out for them with four entirely new scenarios pitting them against the horrors that lurk beneath the ocean waves. With over 150 encounter and event cards, alongside new assets, monsters, conditions, and the terror mechanic, Under Dark Waves boasts a vast undersea treasure trove, pulling you into some of the Cthulhu Mythos’s most compelling tales.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Go For The Gold
Description:
This game is trick-taking game.
The game consists of a 49 playing card deck. The game features top runners and swimmers between 1908 and 1980. The runners and swimmers are ranked on the cards 1 through 48.
Players bid the number of tricks they feel they can take. They try to take tricks they bid.

—user summary

Name: カムレッド (Comrade)
Description:
The trick-taking game ã‚«ãƒ ãƒ¬ãƒƒãƒ‰ (Comrade) is a cooperative game for 3 players, with variants for 4 and 5.  The game lasts over a series of hands equal to the number of players.

In each hand, the players will draft their bid from a set of cards face up on the table to represent how many tricks, and in what suits, they will each win. The available cards are A, 2, 3, and 4, in each of the standard 4 suits.  It is a "must follow" game with no trump and no communication.

After the prescribed number of hands, the players receive a rating for their score over the rounds.

—user summary

Name: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – The Charms and Potions Expansion
Description:
Continue to defend Hogwarts in Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle – The Charms and Potions Expansion!

This second expansion to Hogwarts Battle increases the player count to five heroes thanks the newest playable character — Ginny Weasley! Enhance your experience with charm abilities to aid you as you battle new villains, such as Pansy Parkinson and Marcus Flint, and encounter even more challenges. Trouble is brewing, so only by working together will you be able to protect the Wizarding World from He-Who-Must-Not-Be-Named thanks to the new spells, items, and allies you'll find in the four new packs of content.
Families: Game: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Battle (The OP)

Name: Dragoon: The Might and Magma Expansion
Description:
This modular expansion introduces two volcanoes that can erupt throughout play and a power deck available to all players, and is fully compatible with (but does not require) The Rogue and Barbarian Expansion. You may play with just the volcanoes, or the power deck, or both with any combination of players.

Two volcanoes introduce the ability for players to activate predetermined lava flows on the map to lay waste to their opponents and create gold mines that can be mined for gold. The volcanoes and lava tiles provide additional movement mechanics by sending dragons back to their caves and removing the Rogue and Barbarian from the map to finish their turn.

The power deck introduces a deck of potent abilities available to all players that cost 1 action to use.

In Might and Magma, exploit the folly of humans that brought about the destruction of the surface and the disturbance of an ancient power that had lain dormant, until now.
It turns out that the humans mining the cursed depths of impending peril in search of more gold was somehow not a good idea. As volcanic activity shakes the land, something far worse seems to have awoken amidst the chaos. Now the island’s already most tyrannical are granted strange new powers from an unseen source beneath the island.

—description from the publisher

Name: Will-Yams
Description: The principle of the game is to align cubes "to make combinations like poker or yams". The game consists of 26 cubes, each with two visuals of playing cards. It is played face to face: when all the cubes are turned over, each player announces his best combination: royal flush, square, full, three of a kind, etc.

Name: Trivial Pursuit: National Edition (UK)
Description:
Part of the Parker Travel series.

A twp person (or team) travel version of Trivial Pursuit. The carrying case splits into tow halves, each containing 50 trivia cards, and an affixed scoring piece to hold eared wedges. It also includes a die with 6 colors on it, to randomly determine which question is next asked.

The categories are: Blue- Tourist Traps, Pink- Historical Heritage, Yellow- Arts & Crafts, Brown- Out & About, Green- The Rat Race, and Orange- Sports & Fitness.

Name: Trivial Pursuit: Games and Leisure Edition
Description:
Part of the Parker Travel series.

A twp person (or team) travel version of Trivial Pursuit. The carrying case splits into tow halves, each containing 50 trivia cards, and an affixed scoring piece to hold eared wedges. It also includes a die with 6 colors on it, to randomly determine which question is next asked.

The categories are: Blue- Music, Music, Music, Pink- Down the Pub, Yellow- Home Entertainment, Brown- Sports & Fitness, Green- Lazing, and Orange- Pay to Enjoy.

Name: ノーティス (Notice)
Description:
The trick-taking game ãƒŽãƒ¼ãƒ†ã‚£ã‚¹ (Notice) was originally part of the 2014 Trick Taking Party, and later rule revisions occurred in 2015 and 2018.

The game follows the usual "must follow" trick-taking rules, with a random determination of trump.  Players earn points from predicting how many tricks two hands will win.  Players are dealt one hand, record in secret how many tricks they expect the hand to win, and then pass that hand to another player.  (The specific player the hand is passed to depends upon the round number and player count.) Players then record how many tricks they expect the new hand they've received will win.  This second hand is the hand the player will play the round with.

The game occurs over a number of rounds, and players receive points for each trick won and the accuracy of their bids.

—user summary

Name: DICE-Tractions: Dice Wars
Description:
Players customize armies by selecting dice from their personal collections.  Each die costs points equal to the number of sides it has, and both players spend an equal number of points.  In a series of battles, players roll all their surviving dice, line them up from highest to lowest, and eliminate dice facing a higher rolled value.  Dice with no opponent automatically survive the round.  Repeat until one side is eliminated.

Part of the DICE-tractions series of games.

Name: Play the Franco-Prussian War 1870-1871
Description:
Project made possible by the great and beautiful collection of Gianpaolo Bistulfi, who in many years of modelling career has personally painted thousands of toy soldiers. 
Now these soldiers will be at your disposal to obtain, with little effort, entire armies of battalions of infantry, squadrons of cavalry, batteries of cannons, houses and buildings, trees and much more material needed to create the scenes of your battle. 
We also explain tricks and modes for a good assembly of the pieces, as well as the official rules for playing wargame. All in 50 pages full of hundreds of soldiers supplied in the standard scale of 25/28mm that you can, for personal use only, photocopy on thicker cardboard and thus get armed with the desired size.

So what are you waiting for?

Wear the general commander’s shoulder pads, equip yourself with a capable table, a practical ruler to measure, a pair of dice and get ready to lead hundreds or thousands of armed in epic and exciting battles of history!

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Paper Battles and Dioramas (Soldiershop Publishing)

Name: Dice in Space
Description:
Dice in Space is a solo challenges Roll & Write game, inspired by the theme of Star Trek.

Each turn consists of:

     Rolling the dice
     Movement: The player has to choose where to move his ship according to the results of the rolls, crossing the sides of the hexagons.
     Encounters: Based on the hexagon chosen during the movement phase, the player will compile the Captain's Tactical Map boxes.


When the last available antimatter unit (movement unit) has been used and the executed event does not provide new antimatter, the game ends. At this point you have to sum up all the values noted in the combat boxes, in the Class M and Class D planets boxes, and the highest value marked on the Class A planets. Try to make your best result!

—description from the designer

Name: Delvers of the Forgotten Forest
Description:
Delvers of the Forgotten Forest is a medium weight dice-as-workers game that mixes push your luck with light euro elements. In this game, you will be hiring dice (called delvers) to venture into the forgotten forest and return with knowledge and artifacts. Beware though, the deeper into the forest you go, the more you will be exposed to the corruptions of the forest, and the harder it will be to retrieve your delvers. As more and more delvers enter, the monsters of the forest will awaken to hinder the players. The player who has acquired the most knowledge by the end of the game wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island – Treasure Chest
Description:
Treasure Chest is a special expansion including a complete set of Robinson Crusoe promos that have been released up to 2020, thereby giving players an enormous amount of content and variability to the game.

Inside the box players will find extra Characters (Gamer and Sailor), a set of Crewmen, Hunting Dog, Character Trait cards, additional Mystery cards, Event cards, Discovery Tokens, Searching the Beach cards, Volcano tile, and even an epic Spyglass. Hunting will also get more exciting with new Beast cards and Hunting Adventures cards. Robinson's shelter will get an option of upgrading and adding a Garden and Pen. Treasure Chest will also include four additional scenarios: Tracing Dr. Livingstone, Treasure Island, Poachers, and Time Travel.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Robinson Crusoe – Adventures on the Cursed Island

Name: Ready, Set, WOOF!
Description:
The Puppies at the Park have been playing all day long and now they need a snack!

Shake the Dog Bowl Randomizer to find out which playful pup gets a bone. Then, search the board for the matching dog. Find the Pup with the matching colors first and give it a bone. Find and feed five dogs, and you win in this four-legged find-it game? Sharpens visual discrimination-a key pre-reading skill-and boosts concentration and focus!

When he's not busy inventing board games (Ready, Set, WOOF! is his 105th!), Ivan can be found playing a different kind of game-tug of war with his daughter's Chinese Sharpei, Lola! From Wolfie and Punk to Basco and Lola, there have always been dogs in Ivan's family. Wolfie, Ivan's first dog, is even a key player in his published autobiography, The Puzzlement.

—description from the publisher

Name: Frozen II: Rumbling Rock
Description:
Dodge falling boulders and escape the Earth Giant's anger with this Spin Master Frozen II Rumbling Rock board game. The variety of risks and opportunities add some suspense to the game play. This Spin Master Frozen II Rumbling Rock board game comes with a scenic 3-D insert, so you can do a realistic reenactment of scenes from the Frozen II movie.

—description from the publisher

Name: Smokies-Opoly
Description:
How do you make a game about the great Smoky Mountains?  While it's impossible to include everything, we jammed all the Smokies we could into this box.  It's full of big adventures, family attractions, breathtaking views and of course...a black bear or two - a little something for those who love the mountains!  Looking for a fun way to experience the Land of Blue Mist?

—description from the publisher

Name: Hunting-Opoly
Description:
Buy dream hunting locations, put up cabins and lodges, and charge other players to hunt on your land. Sounds easy enough but add in a hunting violation, a bad duck call, and a long haul in a tree stand, and it's a little more difficult - and a lot more fun! Choose your token and advance to Go Huntin'. Who knows! You may soon be hunting in Big Sky Country... or you may be out of the game for eating too much crock pot possum! Whatever happens, the hunt is on, and you just might become THE ULTIMATE HUNTER.

—description from the publisher

Includes crossbow, shotgun shell, backpack, boot, shed, and binoculars player pieces.

Name: Giddy Up! Game
Description:
Saddle up and ride with horses of every color, breed, and personality! Round-up four beautifully photographed horse cards and read a colorful description of a horse. Then, each player secretly votes which horse best suits that story. Score when your "horse sense" matches other players. You'll be surprised what your horse-loving friends think!

—description from the publisher

Name: Sex, Drugs or Rock-N-Roll
Description:
Sex, Drugs or Rock-N-Roll is an outrageous adult party card game where you can get down and dirty with your friends!

How it works:
Draw a card - this card determines the letter that's now in play for the round. 
Say your word - If the letter B is drawn, every answer needs to start with the letter B that is related to Sex, Drugs or Music (Rock-n-Roll only for advanced play)...Boobs, Bong or Banjo 
Keep going - players say words until 1 remains, if a player can't answer they are out for that round. 
Score - The winner of the round earns the letter card and the next player draws.
Win - The player with the most cards at the end of the game is the champion of SDR!

—description from the designer

Name: The Pursuit of Happiness: Experiences – Maui
Description:
Maui is an additional Trip card that can be added to the Experiences expansion game.

Available as a reward through the Dice Tower 2020 Kickstarter campaign.

Name: Fight Fight
Description:
Players fight each others characters with spells, treasures, magical items and heavy weapons/armor in this fun and fast (30 min) drafting game for 2-4 players.

Fight Fight is a battle drafting game where players control two characters in front of them. At the end of every round, each of your characters will fight their neighboring opponents character to your left and right.

Each round you will draft one card from the pile passed to you, then all players will simultaneously play one of three total cards in hand and then the cards played will resolve...


     Draft Spells to mess with your opponents or give yourself advantages! 
     Draft Treasure cards to out wit your adversaries and take the ever growing treasure pool in the center of the table! 
     Draft End Game Scoring cards to maximize your strategies during the game!
     Most importantly, draft Magical Items and Heavy Weapons and Armor because at the end of every round, your characters each have to Fight Fight!


—description from the publisher

Name: Junk Driver
Description:
Junk Driver is a demolition derby racing game for 2-5 players that takes 45-60 minutes to play. First you draft cards from a selection of engines, weapons, and rocket boosters. Then you race around a track and the first to complete three laps, or the last one standing, wins.

It is set in the far future where racers from all quadrants of the galaxy come together to compete in this annual event. Tiny fairies, demon worshipers, and muscle car enthusiasts all come together to smash together parts from different manufacturers to make something resembling a car.

Gameplay involves everyone zooming around the track taking actions to shift lanes, do drifts, and fire the wide array of weaponry available to them. The game also uses an energy system where actions can be super-charged through a resource gained at the start of the race.

—description from the designer

Name: Suns of Chronos
Description:
You and your people emerge from a glistening fog into a sprawling world much like your own, yet...fabricated? At your backs lie the unending silver dunes you came from. To the east and west stand massive walls that could only be the work of an intelligence much greater than your own. And crackling over the horizon is a massive storm that pulses with an otherworldly glow. Your resources are low, time is short...and you are not alone.

In Suns of Chronos, control one of four races and explore a world full of strange lifeforms and mysterious artifacts. Manage your people and your time wisely, between exploiting the wonders of Chronos - such as the time-defying "sunstones" - and thwarting those who get in your way. Be wary, however. Besides your rivals, Chronos contains entities of its own that will challenge not only your people, but the very fabric of time upon which you depend.

On the machine world of Chronos, those who carry out the will of their people best will go on to see a new universe. The rest will be lost to the sands of time.

—description from the publisher

Name: Gram-R-Fun
Description:
Players attempt to score a bingo on their individual “Parts of Speech” card. A player rolls the die and selects a card from their opponent’s hand. The number rolled determines which word to use on the chosen card for construction of a sentence later in the game. The player must identify the correct part of speech shared by all words on the card. If successful, they add the card to their hand and mark off the appropriate space on their bingo board.

There are Dapper cards in the deck which allow the scoring of one additional point when declaring bingo and constructing a sentence, as well as Zapper cards which prevent a player from declaring bingo as long as they are in possession of that card.

Once a players declares bingo, they must construct a sentence from the cards they have in their hand with the words designated by their previous rolls. A point is scored for each word successfully used. The first player to 21 points wins the game.

Name: Burglar
Description:
Burglar is a whole new twist on family board games.

It's a game involving skill, chance, memory and tactics as you hunt for loot and get the chance to block opponents from reaching their own target items or escaping undetected.

The game board and tiles have the simple elegance of 1920s sophistication and it's one of those games that's simple to learn but different every time you play.

It's a family friendly game that lasts around 30 minutes which gets more devious every time  as you learn tactics to frustrate opponents and use your best negotiating skills to gang up on players.

—description from the designer

Name: Kibrul
Description:
I, King Tenkin, have been robbed of my precious gold crown by the Treacherous Titus. This cruel thief of a dragon is now hiding in the depths of his dark cave. To you who will defy his fames, I offer a prominent place among the knights of my army.
Find allies on your way to form your team but don’t underestimate the Treacherous Titus!

Object of the Game :
Kibrul is a cooperative game in which you collect ally cards to reinforce your team and attack the treacherous Titus in order to decrease his health Points and recover the king’s crown!

Kibrul is a deck-building initiation game.

Name: Carrot Bunny Den
Description:
Carrot Bunny Den is a competitive little card game to share among friends (ages 18+). It is played by 3 to 10 players and games last about 15 minutes. It is very quick to learn and triggers good bursts of laughter. The graphical direction may surprise you but it's just like the gameplay, it looks cute but it's hard!

In Carrot Bunny Den, nature goes crazy and it's up to us to fix it. Each player starts with 3 cards representing combinations of the words "carrot", "rabbit" and " den" and a decadent vision of our poor nature. During the game, the players exchange words by pointing at each other and saying one of these three words. But beware, each word has an associated rule! One must not make mistakes when speaking and remain attentive to the words spoken. Indeed, when a spoken combination corresponds to one of your cards, you can put it down!

It's a game of memory and quick decision making. Players must choose the words they say skillfully and quickly, according to their hand. They choose who they give the floor to based on what they understand of other people's play. They have to adapt constantly to hope to put down every card. The first player to put down all his hand wins the round and the game is played in three winning rounds. Nature needs you! Ready for the challenge?

—description from the designer

Name: Steam Wars
Description:
Built lean, strong, powerful and simple, yet packed with enough Steampunk imagination to get any heart beating like clockwork, Steam Wars is the card game that War was meant to be. Play whole hands of aether-powered heat ray artillery units with support against your foe’s pitiful legions of fusiliers armed with pneumatic cannons, then watch them burn under the force of your might. Clutch your cards in fear as your enemy reveals a hand of steam-mortar emplacements, then bombards your heat-ray artillery into oblivion. Wield a mixed force, sacrifice the weak to distract your enemy, then power on to victory, and all this in about a half an hour! With Steam Wars, you’ll have to use strategy and cunning to overwhelm your foes, forcing them to run through cards until they clutch the last one and sit gibbering as you crush them.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sea Wars
Description: Sea Wars: Light wargame intended for the age ranges of 10 and older.

Name: Histories of War: Empire & Hordes – Western Europe 50 BC - 500 AD
Description:
Histories Of War is a series of historical wargames rules designed to allow players to recreate battles of the period using miniature soldiers or counters on a scenic battlefield.
The system puts the player in the role of a general of large armies and the rules are designed to represent the action occurring simultaneously.

Empire & Hordes pits the army of the Roman Empire against the Barbarian Hordes in central Europe between 50 BC and 500 AD.

Can you re-write the histories of war?

—description from the publisher

Name: Chariots of Chandragupta
Description:
INDIA - 300 BCE

The Royal Mauryan empire taught its children to raise and care for horses as their own, rear them as allies in the battlefield and beyond.

Citizens from far and wide would come to watch competent charioteers race through the forests and the ravines, the rivers and the marshes at the most celebrated chariot races.

The charioteers marked territory and showed immense skill - no obstacle too hard, no weather too dangerous.

And thus was born a legacy - the races of the ‘Chariots of Chandragupta’.

Chariots of Chandragupta is another exciting game from the makers of Yudhbhoomi.

Get ready to race like the royals!

Build a track, choose your charioteer, load your Chariot with resources and spin the arrow. You have 2 actions in your turn: use your resource tokens and spin the arrow (in any order).

You can move fast, earn resources, buy resources and earn some special benefits too. The battle to be first can be influenced/hindered further when you get the 'Karma' cards. Also, watch out for obstacles! Get a lead, lay additional obstacles and be the first charioteer to make it back to the palace to win the race!

—description from the publisher

Name: Knights Of NorthRnd
Description:
Knights of NorthRnd is a 2-6 player, last man standing, medieval themed card game where each player chooses a card from 5 to play at the same time, then the loser losses gems depending on how much damage is dealt, it takes the concept of rock, paper, scissors, but I have changed it to swords, shields and arrows.

—description from the designer

Name: Cosmology
Description:
Your time has come.

You are a celestial being of nearly unlimited power and obsession and, after eons of waiting, you have finally been called to purpose. A universal eruption has occurred, sending cosmic matter barreling across the void and giving you the chance to create beautiful order from raging chaos.

When finished, you will have formed a new galaxy, built according to your own flawless design. But you are not alone. Others have also heard this call of the cosmos and arrived to claim the event for their own destinies.

As the universe watches, you must gather interstellar material to craft and shape the perfect galaxy - one composed of star systems that not only satisfy your own ethereal compulsions, but will attract the primordial forces necessary to cultivate life for millennia to come.

When the stardust settles, only one creation will be worthy of remembrance - will it be yours?

In Cosmology, you and other players compete to draw and place tiles of planetoids, moons, and comets in your own empty voids to create a galaxy of significance, igniting suns to build star systems of color patterns that will attract primordial forces. But you must also fulfill your own private compulsion objectives, which may influence (and limit) your building potential.

—description from the publisher

Name: Phantom Division
Description:
Phantom Division is a fully co-operative tactical combat game set in a sci-fi world of impending danger. Players choose a member of the elite Phantom Division defence force and are dispatched on a mission to protect a remote colony planet against an unknown and implacable enemy. The game features an innovative, challenging AI system that efficiently controls the enemies, different primary and secondary objectives for each mission, and "plot twists" that can introduce unexpected events into the game. Combat is resolved either by rolling dice or by flicking the Phantom's bullets. The flicking based combat is completely optional. It also includes several mini-games where players will pilot shuttles, hack computer terminals, and defuse bombs. At the end of a mission, the players will have the opportunity to upgrade their Phantom for the next mission using XP they collected. The game supports 1-4 players with full solo support.

—description from the publisher

Name: In Country: Grand Tactical Combat In the Vietnam War
Description:
In Country is a Table-top game designed to bring fast and decisive Vietnam War combat from the company level up to the battalion, if desired.

With these rules, players will be able to simulate the small skirmishes, reconnaissance missions, and large scale battles that made up one of the longest wars in American history.

Includes: 

     Unit Statistics Charts, 
     Campaign Considerations, 
     Painting guide with simple steps to help get new painters started, 
     Scenario section with 3 scenarios


For 6 to 15 mm miniatures

—description from the publisher

Name: Giga-Robo: Assault of The Armada
Description:
Expand your Giga-Robo roster!

Terroch Arkan is one of the 8 Zoider Terrochs—warrior kings that each wield an almighty Giga-Core and command their own armada. Terroch Arkan has no Power Token limit, allowing for full Activation of his robot’s abilities, and aggressive dice advantage, demoralizing his foes, and then eradicating them with raw, unbridled power.

ShinOkami is a ferocious machine, running into the fray with a frenzy of combo attacks. It can uniquely interact with Barriers, setting them up across the battlefield and then warping itself, and its attacks, through them, constantly keeping your opponents guessing where it will unleash its fury next!

—description from the publisher

Name: Giga-Robo: Warrior of The Wastes
Description:
Expand your Giga-Robo roster!

Kong, of The Wastes is a ruthless pilot, dissecting opponents with guerilla tactics and the command of her mercenary army. She brings the brand new ability to drop Target tokens onto the battlefield, which can be triggered for a variety of effects, keeping your opponent off-balance.

Ascalon Alpha is an unmatched Ranged Attack robot, built for speed and precision. It bombards multiple opponents and structures with rockets, deftly evades opponents’ counterattacks, and then blasts them from across the entire battlefield with its massive Xyston sniper rifle.

—description from the publisher

Name: Surface Fire: Naval Combat in World War Two
Description:
Surface Fire - Naval Combat in World War 2 is a table-top game designed to simulate the naval engagements that took place all around the globe during World War 2 (from 1939-1945).

The rules have been structured to enable new gamers to readily understand and enjoy playing the game.

Designed for 1/2400th scale ships and planes
1 mini = 1 ship
1 planes base = 1 squadron
1 turn = 10 min

These rules include: 

     Naval Data sheets, 
     Templates, 
     100+ markers


—description from the publisher

Name: Ashigaru: Samurai Combat in the Age of the Country at War
Description:
Ashigaru is a table-top game designed to replicate the samurai combat that took place during the time of the Sengoku Jidai (Age of the Country at War) through the Tokugawa period of Japan (1500-1650). 
With these rules, players will be able to simulate the skirmishes that made up the longest period of internal conflict in Japan’s history.

Includes: 

     Statistics for 26 weapons, 
     80 Wounded markers, 
     a Painting guide with simple


steps to help get new painters started, 

     Scenario section with 4 scenarios.


Designed for 15-25mm miniatures

Scale:
1 turn = 1'
1" = 5 m (15mm)

—description from the publisher

Name: Moonlight Brewers
Description:
CONTEXT
Moonlight Brewers is a game where you'll be playing Trappist monks competing in order to brew the best beer. And as you may guess, they can only do it when the moon is full and the Werewolves roam. Hunters and preys at the same time, the Werewolves are both a danger and the ingredient for the beer.
In order to make it through the night and to brew THE beer, you'll have to build amazing strategies, backed up by a good amount of luck.

HOW TO PLAY
- Pick up the ingredient you need to collect in this phase of brewing. 
- Better ingredient means harder to get and will make more noise.
- Hunt Werewolves as a special ingredient for you beer
- Too much noise and you will be hunted by the Weres
- The Monk with the best beer win the game.

CONTENT
Print & Play game
1 MONASTERY (board)
1 RULES BOOKLET
63 CARDS (19 MONKS, 18 WERE, 13 EQUIPMENTS, 13 BENEDICTIONS)
8 MODS
1 SCARY SHEET
26 SMALL CARDS
THE CAMPAIGN OF THE WHITE WOLF

MORE CONTENT
Hermit Brewer - A solo mode extension : included in basic version
The Night of the Beast : included in basic version

—description from the publisher

Name: Dogfight Over the Trenches
Description:
Dogfight Over the Trenches is a fast-paced and exciting game designed to replicate the air battles and combat missions that took place in the skies over the battlefields of the Great War from 1915 to 1918.

This book contains not only the core rules for playing out missions, but a set of advanced rules for more complex and in-depth gameplay.

There are tons of planes to choose from, and aircraft availability tables to match the year YOU want to fly in!

—description from the publisher

Name: High Noon: Cowboy Skirmish Combat in the American Old West
Description:
High Noon is a fast-paced skirmish game intended to replicate the gun fights, duels, and showdowns that took place in the American Old West from roughly 1840 to 1900.

These rules are intended for 25mm or 28mm figures.

This rules set contains:

     character sheets,
     scenarios,
     80+ markers and templates,
     quick play sheets, and
     guns statistics for 30 weapons.

Name: Pirates
Description:
Pirates is the exciting game of beer drinking and treasure hunting you can play with your whole family.

Dodge aliens, British, tigers, and the mighty Sasquatch in the quest to be the best.

But watch out, because Black Beard the pirate will be out for blood!

—description from the publisher

Name: Boney the Dinosaur
Description:
Boney the Dinosaur is the exciting table top game of beer drinking and paleontology you can play with the whole family. Out wit rattlesnakes, police, angry natives, and the mighty Sasquatch in the quest to be the best.

But watch out, because Boney will be out for revenge!

—description from the publisher

Name: Jowls
Description:
JOWLS is the exciting table top game of scuba diving and beer that you can play  with your whole family.

Swim through red algae, seaweed, and dodge moray eels and the mighty Sasquatch in the quest to be the best.

But watch out, because JOWLS is always hungry!

—description from the publisher

38 page rulebook includes 52 random Event Cards

Name: Switch Which?
Description:
2 Players compete in a game of quick actions to remove the opposing player from the board. The first player without their colored dice on the board or the first player to run out of time, loses.
Switch Which uses a chess clock and each player start with 3 minutes time. The dice are set up with one player starting with 5 dice in their color on the board, the other player starts with 4 dice in their color on the board. Players will alternate turns, rotating the selected dice the difference of numbers on the boards edge. When a player has rotated two dice to their completion, they will stop the chess clock for their time and the other player's turn begin immediately.
Its a race to remove your opponents color from the board, while not taking too much time or accidentally removing yours in the process!

—description from the designer

Name: Mushrooms by Mail
Description:
In Mushrooms by Mail, two players attempt to coordinate their pixie workers to deliver various fungal treats to a band of incredulously fussy trolls.

Players draft dice determining which spaces they can send their pixies to, and attempt to control both the crops of 'shrooms and the access to trolls — as well as the greedy troll that will eat anything!

Collect helper tokens along the way to help augment your dice rolls. Feed the trolls!

—description from the publisher

Name: Braves, Retry!
Description:
In Braves, Retry!, you will be fighting against the dark overlords with the help of different goddesses. Send out your braves toward the different missions, beware of the power of the different goddesses. With the right power, you may defeat the army of dark overlords easily. A meta-story based on the overabundance of Isekai & Reincarnation genre anime.

”I used to be an adventuring Brave, then I took an arrow in the knee.”

Evil Bosses from other planes have conquered the Kingdom of Man…
Courageous warriors and soldiers around the world have all perished in the war…

”My dear Brave, was your knee hit by this Golden Excalibur, or this Silver Kusanagi?”

The 3 Goddesses who watch over the world awakens, and the souls of the Braves are summoned back one by one…

”Um, no… It was just a plain, ordinary arrow…”

The bugle of resistance echoes over the horizon, now it’s your time to save the world again!

”My honest Brave, in the name of the 3 Goddesses, please offer your knees again!”

Players will take turns dispatching their Braves to fight various Bosses by drafting location cards. You may also pray to the 3 Goddesses for special powers to assist you with the battle or hinder other player’s progress. At the end of each round, the player with more Braves in each Battleground gets to pick rewards first from each Boss fight.

The game ends after 5 rounds, then the player with the highest score wins the game.

Name: The Cloud Dungeon 2: Sunken Dungeon
Description:
In The Cloud Dungeon 2: Sunken Dungeon, 1-6 players color and construct their characters, buying and attaching armor and weapons, and making their own, utterly unique creations. Your party is 'borrowing' a submarine and setting out for the Sunken Dungeon: a defunct, dangerous place full of sea creatures, monsters, and green olives. You're hoping there's treasure in there, someplace. Throughout the process, you'll be engaging in hand-to-claw combat with crabs, electrifying whales, and working together to pilot your submarine in intense submarine battles.

Along the way, you'll be making choose-your-own adventure-style decisions as a team, with huge (and ridiculous) consequences. You'll lose your leg, have starfish plastered all over you, and tangle with a Very Cheerful Squid who wants to kill you. It's ridiculous fun for any player who is creative, loves coloring, or wants to have a fun coloring adventure with their friends, family, or game group.

—description from the publisher

Name: Barrage: 5th Player Expansion
Description:
Barrage is now for 5 players.

This expansion includes:

     5 players rules
     5 players map
     1 wheel for the fifth player
     a small management board with additional actions
     an overlay for the turn order
     a new set of contracts
     more wooden machineries


Important note: in order to play with 5 players, you need of core game Barrage and of the orange player set and the fifth company board from  Barrage: The Leeghwater Project.

Name: Spelling Bees
Description:
Spelling Bees is a lasercut literacy game for the family. Each player is a bee that follows invisible paths along flower petals to collect letters and turn them into words.

The game comes with 19 hexagonal flower tiles, each with six letters. The tiles rotate and can be moved, allowing words to be formed from adjacent, contiguous letters.

The board comes with a built-in scoring tracks for six bees (players).

Can be played solitaire.

Can be played in any Roman-based language: English, French, Spanish, Italian, Portuguese.

—description from the publisher

Name: Tales of the Northlands: The Lost Trilogy
Description:
This is a mini expansion consisting of three new invention cards which are added to the inventions deck of the main game. Based upon three erstwhile 'forgotten' Noggin stories from books published in the 1960's.

—description from the publisher

Name: Barrage: Executive Officer Promo B
Description:
2 new Executive Officers distributed exclusively to Kickstarter backers, as part of the 5th player Expansion campaign. Later available in pack E of the Dice Tower 2022 Kickstarter campaign.


Wu Fang:
You have a personal action space. When it is your turn, during the Action Phase, you can place 1 Engineer on this space to produce an amount of energy equal to the number of Water Drops currently held in your Dams. You can't add any bonus to this production, but you can use it to fulfill a Contract. The Water Drops stay where they are after this action.

Dr. Octavius:
When producing energy by activating one of your Powerhouses with a Production action, you can use any Water Drops from one or more of your Dams or Neutral Dams connected to the activated Powerhouse.
When using the German company ability, you can use this ability only with your first production.

Name: Lords of Hellas: Sparta Cards
Description: A set of three cards that every game you choose a random one to display next to the board. It gives an additional power to Sparta.

Name: Art of Command: Rules for Wargaming Large Scale Napoleonic Battles
Description:
The Liphook Historical Wargames Group was formed in 2000 to refight Napoleon’s major battles during their 200th anniversary year. During the last 16 years the group has successfully fought over 38 battles, which have included Wagram, Salamanca, Borodino, Leipzig and Waterloo, using its own, home-grown set of specially designed rules.

Art of Command evolved from the group’s desire to refight big, multiplayer battles. The set aim was to simulate the confusion and impact the chain of command has on such major engagements through the interaction of players representing the various commanders from brigade through divisions and corps to army level. The objective is to replicate the historical ebb and flow of battle at battalion, squadron and battery level, refight them over an accurately contoured, scaled model and complete them in a day.

The group initially tested existing, commercial rule sets but felt that these were designed for small table engagements lasting a couple of hours or larger games with brigades being the smallest units represented. It was concluded that we needed rules that would encompass command, communications and control functions.  Rules that would enable us to coordinate and accommodate a large group of commanders refighting battles the size of Waterloo, but still represent battalions and squadrons on the wargame table.  We believe Art of Command fulfills this need and the fact that the group successfully completed almost all the battles in a day is a testament to the robust nature of the rules and the thorough testing which has taken place.

We recommend Art of Command to those wargamers who wish to simulate a major Napoleonic, multiplayer battle in a day.   We hope that you find their simplicity and resultant speed of play beneficial in recreating your own big battles and, above all, recreate the fun and excitement of a hobby that we all enjoy.

Scale:
1 fig (inf.-cav.) = 50/60 men
1 gun = 1 gun
Ground Scale: 1/1000 for 25/28 mm  (half for 15mm)
each Game Period: 10-15 min real time

—description from the publisher

Name: Crypto Tycoon Card Game
Description:
The world's first crypto-themed card game that offers players an exciting volatile ride that gets solved in under 15 minutes.

With exciting strategic gameplay, even when you think you're about to win or lose, your or another player can turn the game around out of nothing.

Stunning illustrations and a fresh new game concept make Crypto Tycoon a family-friendly card game that's easy to play but challenging to win.

—description from the publisher

Name: Deer Lord!: Emotional Rollercoaster Flirty & Mean
Description:
Expansion to Deer Lord! a party card game with duels and bizarre 'things' for you to 'do' without being exposed by the other players.

Set them up just to knock them down! Showers of compliments and meaningful glances with flirty, torrents of insults and ego bruisers with mean. Prepare to have a lot of mixed feelings.

This dual expansion is quite naughty, so play with friends who can stand mind games... Not suitable for minors.

—description from the publisher

Name: Spiel mit Früchten
Description:
All fruits are put on the plate in middle of the table. The players spin the arrow and take the indicated number of fruits from the plate.

When all fruits are taken, the arrow is spinned again. The player who has the most pieces of the indicated fruit wins the game.

—user summary

Name: In Deo Veritas: Fast Play Rules for Exciting Seventeenth Century Battles in Smaller Scales
Description:
Designed to recreate actual battles, In Deo Veritas focuses on the command decisions needed to maintain the motivation of the army. The six actual battle scenarios provide a range of different challenges from the warfare of the seventeenth century.

Battles are played at the brigade level with all major elements are on 75mm/3" wide bases. 
Using smaller scale figures (6-15mm) lets players give their units a realistic feel. 
The ground scale of 1" = 40yds means the typical 6ft x 4 ft table is large enough to accommodate most battles of the period.

Most players will already have everything needed to play (d6, tape measure and a deck of cards).

To learn the rules will take 2 hours or so using some of the smaller battles. Once you have become familiar with the core elements then your games will flow more quickly and a larger battle such as Wittstock should last for 3-4 hours depending on the arrival of the reinforcements!

Nothing is certain; but generals that hone their skills are more likely to be victorious.

—description from the publisher

Name: Combat Action Command: WWII Miniatures Rules
Description:
Combat Action Command simulates a platoon, several platoons, or a force as large as a company battling another platoon or company. 
CAC is more of a simulation than a game.
CAC was created as a tool for gamers, historians and the military to simulate and study small unit combat -- and to have fun. 

     Command a platoon up to a company
     Geared for 15mm, but can use 10mm, 12mm, and 20mm figures -- no rebasing
     Each Team stand equals one troop squad or single tank, vehicle, or gun
     Asymmetric turn sequence with CAC interrupt allows you to size up the situation, seize initiative, and coordinate small unit tactics
     Clever Data Cards for each unique Team account for training, morale, experience, and weaponry -- you spend more time commanding, not counting
     Includes 24 Data cards covering major US, German, and Soviet units, plus artillery, aircraft, AA, snipers, HQs, mortars, and speciality weapons like Molotov cocktails and balanced scenarios
     Points system for tournaments and balanced scenarios
     Two 1944 scenarios included: 
         Saving Private Ryland (West Front) and 
         Saving Field Marshall Model (East Front)
    
     Requires six-sided dice, twenty-sided dice, a scatter die, and a ruler

Name: For Queen and Planet: Supplemental Rules – The Martian Punitive Expedition 1901
Description:
A planet to be conquered, vengeance to be wreaked and glory to be won. That is the motivation of the commander of the Martian Punitive Expedition of 1901.

With these rules, you can take the role of the British commander tasked by the Queen with taking the fight to the Cephalopod invaders of Earth. You have been given three Ether flyers and the best soldiers the British Empire could muster and you are headed to Mars to do the Queen’s bidding.

Q&P is designed to balance the mass and ferocity of the local races of Mars against the technology and training of the Colonial powers and to provide a fair and reasonable struggle for both imperial General and Martian Odwar.

This rule set does include the following:

     All rules necessary to play a VSF version of the game.
     An alternative timeline for VSF genre play.
     Unit lists detailing British, Imperial Red Martian, Black Martian, Green Martian and Cephalopod forces.
     A eight-scenario campaign that will allow you to play your way through the British Punitive Expedition to Mars in 1901 from the initial encounters with Red Martian Miltia forces all the way through to the final destruction of the British forces on Mars.
     A blank unit command sheet.


CAMPAIGN SCENARIOS:
Each of the scenarios in this rulebook is written to be fought as a pure VSF battle. The theme for this scenario book is fairly light-hearted and many of the scenarios are spun out from scenes from movies, that you will likely recognize. So enjoy and have fun.

The Martian Punitive Expedition Scenarios:

     Hit the Red Shores – Dec 21, 1901 British vs. Red Askari (local Imperial militia)
     Low Plains Drifters – Apr 12, 1902 – Green Martians with British allies vs. Imperial Martians
     A Canal Too Far – Jun 4, 1902 - British vs. Imperial Martians
     The Imperials Strike Back – Oct 3, 1902 – Imperial Martians vs. British
     Imperial Indigestion – Nov 1, 1902 – British/Imperials vs. Black Martians/Cephalopods
     It Ain’t Easy Being Green – Mar 15, 1903 – British/Imperials vs. Green Martians/Cephalopods
     The Martian Candidate – Jul 17, 1903 – British/Imperials vs. Black/Green Martians
     The Last Days of HMS Astra - Dec 19, 1903 - British vs. Imperials


—description from the publisher

Name: For Queen and Planet: Supplemental Rules – Campaign Theme: The Boxer Rebellion 1900
Description:
An ancient nation, a powerful military and thousands of fanatical anti-foreign Boxers are arrayed against a handful of troops from eight nations. The foreign legations are under siege and foreigners are being murdered.

You have no choice, but to take the forces at hand, face the overwhelming enemy on the field of battle and either prevail or be annihilated. 

For Queen and Planet is a fast-play battalion level colonial and VSF rule set. This supplement recreates many of the most famous and less known battles of the Boxer Rebellion. For example, early in the rebellion the Qing Chinese tried to snuff out the rebellion, there were major and epic battles in Manchuria between the Russians and the Qing.

While the focus of this suplement is the Seymour and Gaslee Expeditions, this supplement opens the door wider to shine a light on other players in the conflict (including one VSF scenario that postulates the Emperor Dowager has called on the 'Martians' of The War of the Worlds fame for assistance}.

The Boxer Rebellion Scenarios:

     Imperial Disfavor – May 14, 1900 – Qing vs. Boxer
     A Failed Advance – June 18, 1900 - Seymour Expedition vs. Kansu Braves/Boxer
     The Relief at Hsi-Ku Armory – June 25, 1900 – Seymour Expedition vs. Qing/Boxer
     The Battle of Daku (Taku) Forts– June 17–18, 1900 - Allies vs. Qing
     The Battle of Tientsin– July 13-14, 1900 – Eight Nations vs. Qing/Boxers
     The Battles of Pei-Tsang and Yangtsun – August 5-6, 1900 – Eight Nations vs. Qing/Boxer
     In Pursuit of Foreign Devils (VSF) – June 28, 1900 – Eight Nation vs. Qing/Boxer/Cephalopod
     Battles Along the Amur – June 28, 1900 – Qing vs. Russians


—description from the publisher

Name: Champions Coliseum
Description:
After slumbering for 1000 years, the great wizard Magnus awoke to a shattered world. What was once a single, connected world had become four distinct continents. With the aim of finding heroes with the ability to connect the world once again, Magnus departed towards the ice continent Frirna by airship. It was only then that he learned of an invisible force referred to as the Corruption that had turned some of the world’s greatest heroes against one another…

Champions Coliseum is a 2-4 player competitive card game where you select a party of characters and fight until only one party remains. With 24 characters, 20 unique items, and 15 events, every match is a completely new experience!

Players begin by selecting characters for their party in a draft pick setting. Once the game begins, players take turns by using actions with a character. The game progresses until only one player has characters remaining alive.

Champions Coliseum’s strategy comes through masterful use of elemental abilities, positioning, items, and events. Elemental abilities deal double damage to opposing elements—however, this means that each element’s weakest target is also its biggest threat. Characters placed in the back row cannot be attacked until the character in front of them is defeated, meaning that weaker characters are often placed in the back. Items and events are dealt randomly each round, adding a hint of chance to the strategic gameplay.

—description from the publisher

Name: Table Air Combat: B-29 Superfortress
Description:
Table Air Combat is a fast, simple air combat game that can be played on any flat surface.  All you need are some six-sided dice and some coins to provide weight for the aircraft counters.  Everything else can be printed from this ruleset.

Each player has a flight of four bombers, represented by two counters.  Aircraft counters move by means of curved “performance rulers” that represent the aircraft’s historical cornering ability and maximum speed

Each performance ruler is unique to each aircraft, and contains all the speed, cornering, and weapon information needed.

TAC is designed for portability;  The entire game can fit in a plastic bag.  Even the largest battles can take place on a fast-food restaurant table.

Each aircraft is sold separately.  Only pay for the ones you want, and print out as many copies as you need to create your own epic WWII air battle.

The B-29 Superfortress performed strategic bombing of Japan's factories and infrastructure.  A pressurized cockpit reduced crew fatigue, allowing long flights over the ocean.  The Superfortress featured heavy defensive armament and a massive bomb load.

This set is a self-contained rulebook with miniatures for the B-29 Superfortress and four scenarios that reference other aircraft:

     Target 357: At high altitudes, Ki-84 Franks  intercept B-29s inbound to the Nakajima engine plant in Tokyo.
     Thumper:  A lone B-29 tries to escape a lone Ki-61
     Firestorm: B-29s drop incendiary bombs on Tokyo at night. Defending Ki-84 depend on spotlights to illuminate the bombers.
     Target 357 Again: The capture of Iwo Jima allows P-51D Mustangs to escort B-29s, while Ki-61s protect the factory complex.


This set contains miniatures for the B-29, along a city target,  flak templates, spotlight templates, illumination markers, and and hit markers.  The other aircraft must be purchased separately.

—description from the publisher

Name: Black Seas: Royal Navy 3rd Rates of Renown
Description:
This box set outfits you with three Royal Navy Third-Rate-Ships-of-the-line. Building upon the superb third rate plastic sprues, the box contains additional metal components to make the following famous vessels, all of which were present at the Battle of Trafalgar!

HMS Bellerophon - This 74 gun third rate has a long and storied history, serving during the French Revolutionary and Napoleonic Wars. Whilst most of this time was spent on blockades or convoy escort duties, she distinguished herself in three fleet actions: The Glorious First of June, the Battle of the Nile, and the Battle of Trafalgar. At Trafalgar, she fought an embittered battle against both Spanish and French ships and suffered heavy losses including the death of her Captain, John Cooke.

After Trafalgar, she resumed blockade duties around France, as well as performing more escort duties in North America between 1813 and 1814. Assigned to blockade Rochefort in 1815, HMS Bellepheron was the vessel on which Napoleon came aboard to officially surrender to the British following his defeat at Waterloo (finding his escape to America blocked).

HMS Revenge - Launched on 13 April 1805, HMS Revenge was a 74-gun third rate. She was one of a larger class of 74s with 24-pounder guns on the upper deck rather than the more common 18-pounders.

Newly commissioned, and under the command of Captain Robert Moorsom, she served at the Battle of Trafalgar in Admiral Collingwood's column. She would continue to serve until 1842.

HMS Tonnant - An 80-gun third-rate of the Royal Navy, she was originally the lead ship of the French Tonnant class captured by the British at the Siege of Toulon (August 1793), recaptured by the French at the break of the Siege (December 1793) and subsequently recaptured by Horatio Nelson's fleet at Aboukir Bay during the Battle of the Nile (1 August 1798). She would go on to fight at the Battle of Trafalgar against the French.

Tonnant was the flagship of Vice-Admiral Sir Alexander Cochrane over the majority of the Chesapeake Bay campaigns as part of the War of 1812. Of particular note, Francis Scott Key dined aboard the Tonnant as part of a prisoner release negotiation. As a result of their inferred knowledge of the forthcoming attack on Baltimore at Fort McHenry. As a result, he and his fellows were not allowed to return until after the attack. It was in witnessing the bombardment of Fort McHenry that Key wrote the poem 'Defence of Fort M'Henry' later to become "The Star Spangled Banner".

—description from publisher
